Content.Text:
<FACE_LILIE><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Wow, that sounds so cool, doesn't it? I'd love to
try making a wish once, too!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hello there, <MYNAME>. 
<PAGE>
<FACE_LILIE><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>Hi, <MYNAME>! AH! Wait a second...what time
is it?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LILIE><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>ACK! Seriously, it's that late?! Crud, I'd better get
going!
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>See ya, Angela! <MYNAME>!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sheesh. I keep telling her, if she'd budget her
time more efficiently, she wouldn't have to rush
like that!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>But there she goes, still rushing. Honestly, it's
hard to tell if she really is the responsible type,
or just fooling us all.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hm? What were we talking about? Well...
<PAGE>
Basically, there's a legend about a magical
spring somewhere up on the mountain. If you
throw a special item into that spring...
<PAGE>
...the story says that a goddess appears and
grants you any one wish your heart desires.
<PAGE>
We were talking about what wishes we might
make, if that spring were real.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I know it's just wishful thinking. It's like asking
what we would do if we won the lottery.
<PAGE>
But, if that spring really did exist, what would
you wish for, <MYNAME>?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I see. That does sound like something you'd
wish for.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>But wouldn't it be much more rewarding to earn
that distinction through your own hard work,
and not a wish?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Keep working hard, <MYNAME>. I'm sure
someone of your skill and talent will be able to
make that dream come true.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, I have some business I need to take
care of. If you'd excuse me, please. See you
later, <MYNAME>!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>
Wh-why would you make a wish to a goddess
for something like that?
<PAGE>
Simply getting closer to me wouldn't benefit
you, in the strictest sense...

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
What do you mean, "just getting to know you
better would be enough?"
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>You haven't thought this through, have you?
<PAGE>
You would waste your one wish--a wish you
could use for anything--just for that? When,
again, you could pick ANYTHING else?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Plus you'd be using magic to force someone's
feelings to change. Isn't that kind of...not very
nice?
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>If you really want to get closer to me, then keep
putting in the work to get to know me, and be
sincere about it!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOVE>
O-oh my gosh, would you listen to me?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Hmph. I hear you say something silly, and off I
go.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>
Well, it's probably best to end this conversation
here.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I have other things I need to attend to. If you
would excuse me, please. Goodbye,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Wishing to be closer to me... How strange.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>
If that's your wish, I suggest you go to the
restaurant.
<PAGE>
Then instead of throwing an arcane object into a
spring, you can pay a regular person with regular
money. Whoosh, wish granted.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, I have business I need to attend to. If
you would excuse me, please. See you later,
<MYNAME>.
